attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
With the government discusing the posibility of introducing road pricing I demand the government consider subsidising  PUBLIC TRANSPORT. 


Examples:

Its cheaper for me to travel from Bristol to Manchester by air than using VIRGIN TRAINS. 

Using PUBLIC TRANSPORT ( bus - train - coach )travelling from Wiltshire to London Heathrow (3hrs 30 minutes) costs £87.00  Parking at LHR for a month costs £90.00. (2hrs)
Who wants the inconvenience of extra travel
 time, carrying luggage on & off three types of transport saving £3.00 to consider the environment and being a good citizen!

Oyster card £80.00 per month.
Travel time from Hammersmith to Central London W1 before Congestion Charging - 30 minutes.

After the charging was introduced 60 minutes.
(The newly introduced western extension) travel time - 60 minutes.

Prime Minister: You gave John Prescott the duty to introduce an intergrated TRANSPORT SYSTEM in 1993. 

How is the country benefiting from your request?

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
